FEATURED.title: There
FEATURED.description: This is the opening piece for the amazing "Stone King III" game! It utilizes some absolutely epic orchestral instruments to really tell the player's ears that he or she is about to embark on one of the greatest journeys of his or her lives! One of my main focuses while creating this piece was to keep the rhythm moving forward with the percussion. It really creates a sense of progression and really pumps up the excitement! Let's go Stone King!!
FEATURED.albumDescription:
These are some of my favorite tracks that I have worked on! I love writing music and creating some awesome sounds.

Keyboard shortcuts:
LEFT/RIGHT [CTRL] [SHIFT]: Scrub audio [Adjust Speed] [Scrub song]

SHIFT + UP/DOWN: Adjust volume

SPACE [SHIFT]: Play/pause [1st: Set loopA, 2nd: Loop, 3rd: Unset]

R: Toggle play mode
FEATURED.albumDescriptionShort: A very cool collection of awesome music!

FEATURED.title: Nostalgia
FEATURED.description: This piece is the very first in-game piece that the player hears. I focused on creating more of an ambient sound. Each instrument kind of comes together through various quick melodies and rhythms which creates an interesting environment through the music.
FEATURED.descriptionShort: Vibe in the forest of magical vibes.

FEATURED.title: Legendary
FEATURED.description: As I have learned, I really enjoy when a piece of music has a lot of different instruments playing different things that eventually come together at different points. I think "Legendary" really emulates my joy in that it uses some very interesting rhythms and melodic phrases that reside in a time signature of 7! This kidn of stuff excites me as a writer and creator!!

FEATURED.title: Ready of Sleep
FEATURED.description: While I listen to this piece I am able to find my center and really relax. This piece was perfect as the choice for the world map because as you adventure the vast lands of "Stone King II" you can chill out and really vibe with the music. It is almost as if the main core of the section is under water.

FEATURED.title: In The Red
FEATURED.description: This is the great opener for the "Stone King" RPG game. It contains a lot of big and epic sounds. My objective was to introduce the soundtrack of the game with a massive and strong first-impression. I used the 5/4 time signature to keep the listener on his or her toes and really amped up the volume to excite the player and open them up to the world of "Stone King."

FEATURED.title: Forever Strong
FEATURED.description: This piece is truly awesome! It uses a drum set with lots of very interesting rhythmic variations which is quite different from the other songs in "Stone King." As I was writing this piece, I really enjoyed writing the introduction to the A section where it slows down and slams on a myriad of hits on the different drum kit instruments. Since this is basically the opener for the fight, this really gets the player in the right mind set of: "Okay we are about to initiate something really intense!"

FEATURED.title: Field of Grass
FEATURED.description: "Field of Grass" is a very fun song that has some nice melodies! Whenever I listen to it I imagine I'm outside on a nice summer day. The piano does a fantastic job of keeping the mood of the song light and happy.
FEATURED.descriptionShort: Imagine running down a hill during summer with your friends!

FEATURED.title: Relaxing
FEATURED.description: "Relaxing" is a very nice piece that I could listen to forever. It has an excellent song structure and creates a quite wonderful environment. The different instruments layer well and the vibe it gives off is quite excellent. Very meditative.

FEATURED.title: asdf
FEATURED.description: I'm not sure how I wrote this piece, but I think that it's very cool! It has some pretty crazy melodic intricacies that keeps the piece instresting. In addition, the rhythmic complexity is very cool as well. There are a lot of things going on musically with only a few different synths and drums.

FEATURED.title: Execution
FEATURED.description: Execution is a fast-paced song with lots of action in every music part! There are lots of interchanged ideas betwen each instrument. I had a lot of fun writing this one because each musical element (like rhythm, melody and progession) spoke to each other.

stone-king-iii.title: There
stone-king-iii.description: This is the opening piece for the amazing "Stone King III" game! It utilizes some absolutely epic orchestral instruments to really tell the player's ears that he or she is about to embark on one of the greatest journeys of his or her lives! One of my main focuses while creating this piece was to keep the rhythm moving forward with the percussion. It really creates a sense of progression and really pumps up the excitement! Let's go Stone King!!
stone-king-iii.albumDescription: This is the original sound track for the RPG, ["Stone King III"|/games/stone-king-iii]. The music for "Stone King III" was written to capture the element of what it really feels like to be inside the game.
stone-king-iii.albumDescriptionShort: The original sound track for "Stone King III"

stone-king-iii.title: Catching Fairies
stone-king-iii.description: "Catching Fairies" is a very relaxed piece that simply sets the tone for the initial part of the game. It's music focus uses lots of synths to introduce the player to new and exciting sounds. In addition, this piece serves as a segue to the actual game-play. The "mood" of the game is introduced from within this piece.
stone-king-iii.descriptionShort: Wake up into a magical world of wonder.

stone-king-iii.title: Nostalgia
stone-king-iii.description: This piece is the very first in-game piece that the player hears. I focused on creating more of an ambient sound. Each instrument kind of comes together through various quick melodies and rhythms which creates an interesting environment through the music.
stone-king-iii.descriptionShort: Vibe in the forest of magical vibes.

stone-king-iii.title: Arm Yourself
stone-king-iii.description: My main focus with "Castle of Light" was to really get the player to feel like they are in an epic castle. It uses lots of different horn sounds and uses the orchestra snare to move the piece forward with excellent force.
stone-king-iii.descriptionShort: Welcome to the Castle of Light!

stone-king-iii.title: In Town
stone-king-iii.description: Originally developed earlier for one of the previous Stone King games, this piece worked out for the world map. I thought it had kind of a cool curious, question asking tone to it which I feel was right for viewing the world map. The player can just sit there and loook around thinking about where they want to go while the music plays aloong.

stone-king-iii.title: Cattle's Theme
stone-king-iii.description: I love the calmness of this piece! It really brings the whole game together because it sounds like how I think a town would sound like in tthe context of this game. The melodies in this piece really give off neat town vibes and as I listen to it I just want to find some quests to embark on.
stone-king-iii.descriptionShort: Ahhh, there's no place like home!

stone-king-iii.title: Go Forth
stone-king-iii.description: A short piece, "Go Forth" is very hard-edged and rhythm-heavy. It's rugged tones and rhythms is analogous to the harshness of the activity of mining. As the player is improving their mining they can really get into the groove of this piece.

stone-king-iii.title: Oden's Discomfort
stone-king-iii.description: Orcs have invaded the lands! This piece is a simple one that functions an awkward background environment as the player is unfamiliar territory. It's odd time-signature, 5/4, aids the oddness of they player's situation as they are surrounded by orcs.

stone-king-iii.title: Stranded
stone-king-iii.description: Within this piece, I convey the magical and unknown of the Evil Forest. This location is halfway between the good and evil castles and opens a new door to the dark and evilness of the game. Thus, in the music, I wanted to distill a bit of mystery and wonder in the player through the different sounds of this piece. While it's melodies and rhythms are short and skeptical, I also wanted it to feel kind of magical.

stone-king-iii.title: Escape
stone-king-iii.description: "Escape" is a short piece that will keep the player at a feeling of uneasiness. It uses soome very odd and out-of-place melodic transformations that adds to the creepiness of the Dark Prison. A lot of the tones created in this piece should really make the player want to turn the other way and escape!
stone-king-iii.descriptionShort: True fear produced by a synth.

stone-king-iii.title: Scared
stone-king-iii.description: This piece attempts to present a feeling of a town or village without being entirely good-natured. It has some interesting and questionable melodies that take away from the feeling of safety yet has a groove that is somewhat familiar and comfortable. My goal with this piece was to create a sound that was comforting however not entirely safe.
stone-king-iii.descriptionShort: This does NOT feel like home!

stone-king-iii.title: Final
stone-king-iii.description: "Final" is the last piece in "Stone King III." It is very loud and scary which is reflective of the enemies that reside in the Castle of Darkness.
stone-king-iii.descriptionShort: Castle of Darkness!! Let's go final boss!!

chicken-is-chicken.title: Super Chicken
chicken-is-chicken.description: The primary song of this album, Super Chicken, defines the mood of the album. 'Live life as it is.' Throughout this song, synthetic melodies, and instrumental excitements rile up the listener through jammin' tones.
chicken-is-chicken.descriptionShort: Explore the magic of chicken evolved.
chicken-is-chicken.albumDescription: This album is dedicated to having lots of fun with music writing. I explore lots of different rhythmic and melodic avenues and get very colorful with the music.

chicken-is-chicken.title: The Game
chicken-is-chicken.description: Forward into the colorful sounds, and fast melodies of 'The Game.' Within this song, the drums carry the listener with complex rhythms, and offsetting tones, as the E. Piano, and Piano provide chordal structure to assist the melodic instruments.
chicken-is-chicken.descriptionShort: Play the game! Get those tones.

chicken-is-chicken.title: Steep Stones
chicken-is-chicken.description: Symbolic of deviance, the song, Steep Stones, brings an odd rhythm within the base drum of the middle section. Having such a rhythmic pattern extends the ideal that Steep Stones can be unpredictable at times.

chicken-is-chicken.title: 55 Ramen
chicken-is-chicken.description: With some inspiration from a movie, 55 Ramen rides on a melodic train throughout most of the song. This electric song excites the listener, using repetition and an odd time signature.

chicken-is-chicken.title: Choice
chicken-is-chicken.description: This orchestral song shows a feeling of movement. As the violin advances the melodic tones of this song, the listener will feel a pulse of extreme motivation.
chicken-is-chicken.descriptionShort: Everyone gets to choose their path.

chicken-is-chicken.title: Ambition
chicken-is-chicken.description: Envelope yourself in the inspiration that is Ambition. Using odd meter, this song utilizes a motivational rhythmic pattern to inspire the listener, and carry him or her to all new states of mind.

chicken-is-chicken.title: Big Thanks
chicken-is-chicken.description: Extreme drum speeds carry the listener through an adventure of sounds with the accompaniment provides background for the drums to expand upon.
chicken-is-chicken.descriptionShort: This song contains really fantastic drum fills :D

chicken-is-chicken.title: Lume
chicken-is-chicken.description: Super funky E. Piano riff song. Lots of vibes going between both the piano and the E. Piano. With help from the drums, and other instruments, this fast pace song brings harmonies to a new level.

times-of-immunity.title: Danger Zone
times-of-immunity.description: Danger Zone is an original piece. Throughout the piece, it variates the A section in several ways: change in melodic content, equalization, and tempo. Experimenting the new ways to express the same sounds created from the A section was fun, and interesting.
times-of-immunity.descriptionShort: RUN! It's the danger zone! Lots of really cool variations.
times-of-immunity.albumDescription: While writing this album I focused on writing extremely fun songs with lots of variation and 'things happening' in every part.
times-of-immunity.albumDescriptionShort: A lot of fast-moving parts with fun rhythmic content!

times-of-immunity.title: Unknown Area
times-of-immunity.description: A diverse instrumental piece. The odd meter, 5/4, allowed me to write the drum pattern in a fashion which felt like 4/4, however, because there was an extra beat, I was able to include displacement in the pattern, causing unfamiliarity: reflective of the title. The melody is thoroughly enjoyed by myself.
times-of-immunity.descriptionShort: Where am I!? I've never seen this place before!! Melody is as cool as beans.

times-of-immunity.title: Fast Travel
times-of-immunity.description: The exciting piece: "Fast Travel" embraces its speed through the drum track. As a pianist, I love listening to and writing technical drum sequences; "Fast Travel" uses fast fills accompanied by a very comforting tune. My favorite section is the C section, where the drum solo takes place.
times-of-immunity.descriptionShort: The speed of light is: 299,792,458 meters per second (670,616,629 mph). My car only goes like 100 mph.

times-of-immunity.title: Immune
times-of-immunity.description: DnB song, Immune. A sweet sounding, fast-paced song packed with synthetic pads, drums, and melodic content! Having wanted to make a Drum & Bass song for ages, I made this, and it turned out awesome. My favorite section is what I call the "poly sect.." It occurs after the melody comes in: a synthetic (faster) counter-melody plays a poly on top of the melody. Then it is manipulated into a new poly-rhythm, and finally, it's double layered (and panned a bit). I can't believe how totally "redic" it turned out.

times-of-immunity.title: During Dark Times
times-of-immunity.description: An inspiring, metal piece: "During Dark Times." During the dark hour of dark times, hope must be restored. The intensive shredding along with the progressive metal beat, resembles dark times; while the fast, and inspiring chord progressing- played by the synthetic breath, and strings- bring hope and insight.
times-of-immunity.descriptionShort: The duality between life and darkness!

times-of-immunity.title: At Main Street
times-of-immunity.description: A familiar tune created within the walls of my High School, Main Street School Of Performing Arts. Our group combined our courageous efforts to theme a song based on a picture (of Bruce Lee). This is my version of our song from 2012.

times-of-immunity.title: Focus
times-of-immunity.description: A calming song, "Focus." Throughout this song, synthetic pads carry the listener through a smooth moment of relaxing sounds; the switch between minor and major ensue the listener elude tensions, and welcome a restful state.
times-of-immunity.descriptionShort: Very contrasting to the other songs. A very nice break in the album.

times-of-immunity.title: In Town
times-of-immunity.description: Possible candidate for the town music in my upcoming game, Stone King 3: "In Town." This piece captures the ambient feeling of being in a video game town. The character shops for items and peacefully goes about his or her virtual life, knowing: no harm breaches the walls of the town.
times-of-immunity.descriptionShort: This has 'video game adventure music' written all over it.

times-of-immunity.title: Reflection
times-of-immunity.description: Reflection: a melodic piece. In this piece, I use an on-going build up to reflect the interesting green color which slowly shows itself, while you peer through a mirror, which is in directly in front of another mirror. Interesting fact, the color of a mirror, is green.
times-of-immunity.descriptionShort: What is the color of a mirror?

times-of-immunity.title: My Shield
times-of-immunity.description: An epic, war-like original, titled "My Shield." After discovering how to do so, I placed a "Bass Drop." in the introduction! I was exhilarated upon the result of it. I called it "My Shield," because the sound of the low timpani drums reminds of scenes in movies like 300, or Lord of the Rings, in which armies rally up their excitement by hitting their shields before going to war.
times-of-immunity.descriptionShort: YAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA! This is a very motivating song.

the-super-souper.title: Execution
the-super-souper.description: Execution is a fast-paced song with lots of action in every music part! There are lots of interchanged ideas betwen each instrument. I had a lot of fun writing this one because each musical element (like rhythm, melody and progession) spoke to each other.
the-super-souper.albumDescription: This album is an exploration of lots of different sounds and how they interact with each other. I play around with interesting melodic and rhythmic patterns and pass them throughout each part.

the-super-souper.title: Foundation
the-super-souper.description:
In this piece, you will hear a lot of changes in the amount of reverb and tonality of the instruments. I was happy with how this turned out because it came from playing around with automation of unusual effects.

[01:45]: At this time, the drums finally come in and perfectly sync with the awesome five over four pattern.

the-super-souper.title: Get Finished
the-super-souper.description: Chill out and relax with some of your favorite friends - this song is focused on using the bass synth as the core part of the song. Each other element is built around it in order to make some sweet sounding beats.

the-super-souper.title: The Super Souper
the-super-souper.description: This song tests out unique melodic and rhythmic content to the maximum. I focused on added strange music phrases together in short chunks to attempt to make a weird yet sort of cohesive sound.
the-super-souper.descriptionShort: Interesting instrumentation strategies to the maximum!

the-super-souper.title: The Bowl
the-super-souper.description: "The Bowl" is an interesting collection of different sounds all put together.
the-super-souper.descriptionShort: More elements of surprise in the rhythm section.

the-super-souper.title: It's cool
the-super-souper.description: I focused on a hyper-rigid song-writing strategy when writing this piece. I use lots of looping parts and focus on the solo parts primarily.

the-super-souper.title: Solo It
the-super-souper.description: Very fun to simulate a solo guitarist with a loop pedal. I actually used a Timpani kit to substitute the sound of the pedal being pressed.

the-super-souper.title: Don't Care
the-super-souper.description: I had this major urge to compose a techno song! The urge is satisfied! I dropped the bass, and attempted a dubstep sound; the result was more techno. Woo Party!

the-super-souper.title: The Divine
the-super-souper.description: This is the mellow song. Great to relax to, just chill out.

the-super-souper.title: Prayers
the-super-souper.description: Voices! I love listening to choral music and took great inspiration from classical music. I focus on strong part-writing tools and creating a very relaxing compositional sound.
the-super-souper.descriptionShort: I could go to sleep to this.

one-super-battle.title: Fast Action
one-super-battle.description: This piece is extremely fast-paced and just represents the intensity at which this game music be played. Since the title screen has lots of shaking text, I figured the music should be that insane as well.
one-super-battle.albumDescription: ["One Super Battle"|/games/one-super-battle] has a few songs that are very high intensity and keep that going for the entire time. The purpose of the soundtrack for this game is to keep the player highly alert! It is, after all, "One Super Battle!"

one-super-battle.title: Fight Fight
one-super-battle.description: This piece repeats through the entirety of the game and attempts to keep the gameplay intensity at its highest. It uses fast noises that keep the listener's ears occupied.

one-super-battle.title: Before the Storm
one-super-battle.description: In contrast to the other songs, this piece is very mellow. As the player rests in the lobby, the music keeps their feelings at bay before they rise to infinity once they find a match. I used a neat piano and synth combination to keep the overall tone very mellow and chill.
one-super-battle.descriptionShort: Take a breather from all that action.

stone-king-ii.title: Never Die
stone-king-ii.description: This is the very first piece of music that the player hears when he or she opens the game. It opens up with a cool collection of different sounds and hops right into some more interesting tones. As it progress to the main section, it slams down with confidence the main section! I enjoy the energy that this piece brings to the table. It ramps up it's intensity to the max.
stone-king-ii.descriptionShort: Welcome to a world of some wicked tones!
stone-king-ii.albumDescription: The soundtrack for ["Stone King II"|/games/stone-king-ii] has a loot of different and interesting melodies and time signatures. A lot of unique instrumentations work together to ignite the player's ears with incredible sounds thatt have a large range in intensity. While writing the music for "Stone King II," I focused on creating very interesting phrases that peaked my interest as a composer.

stone-king-ii.title: Remember the Fallen
stone-king-ii.description: This piece is the background noise that plays during the backstory part of the game. It has some nice quiet shaker sounds in the background that keep the pace moving forward while the voice sound utilize some interesting chords. I enjoy the calmness that this piece provides as the user is reading the story information.

stone-king-ii.title: Meditate
stone-king-ii.description: I really like the sounds that are in this piece. It has lots of really dynamic synth sounds that perform some cool manipulations on the tone. I am able to sit and listen to this piece over and over because of all the meditative sounds going on.

stone-king-ii.title: Ready of Sleep
stone-king-ii.description: While I listen to this piece I am able to find my center and really relax. This piece was perfect as the choice for the world map because as you adventure the vast lands of "Stone King II" you can chill out and really vibe with the music. It is almost as if the main core of the section is under water.

stone-king-ii.title: Less Than X
stone-king-ii.description: This piece is the first piece that the player hears while they are in control of their character. It has quite fun and short. All of the instruments stay in a very happy major key and use some neat notes to create a neat piece.
stone-king-ii.descriptionShort: Welcome to the Maro Village! Please enjoy your stay!

stone-king-ii.title: A Long Road Home
stone-king-ii.description: "A Long Road Home" has a very nice sound to it that is very homely. It reminds me of just walking home and enjoying life as it is. A lot of the instruments in this piece move together and it creates a kind of wave which goes back and forth. Something I really like about this piece is that the melody stays very happy throughout the piece.

stone-king-ii.title: Legendary
stone-king-ii.description: As I have learned, I really enjoy when a piece of music has a lot of different instruments playing different things that eventually come together at different points. I think "Legendary" really emulates my joy in that it uses some very interesting rhythms and melodic phrases that reside in a time signature of 7! This kidn of stuff excites me as a writer and creator!!

stone-king-ii.title: Unfamiliar Area
stone-king-ii.description: I like the rhythmic interest in this piece. There are a lot of different percussion instruments being played at the same time and it really keeps me on my toes! It was fun to add more and more layers in tthe introduction of the piece. This adding of layers really helps build up the momentum of the piece.

stone-king-ii.title: Strength
stone-king-ii.description: "Strength" utilizes a lot of interesting changes in the time signature which adds to the mystery of the location that the player is in. I really like how odd and out-of-place this piece feels. The rhythm and melodic parts are kind of on their own page and come together from time to time.

stone-king-ii.title: Death Wait
stone-king-ii.description: This piece plays when the player has died. It has long-held notes on strings and keeps a constant rhythm moving the piece forward. I like the vibe that it gives off - sort of as if we are resting in a tomb and are eagerly waiting to return to the realm of the living at any moment.

stone-king-ii.title: They Have Fought
stone-king-ii.description: "They Have Fought" is the main battle music. This piece is utilizes some interesting drum rhythms which makes it seem almost like it's in a different time signature than 3/4 but it stays in 3/4 the whole way! I really like the interesting phrases and changes in the regular structure as it carries on. I think the musical relationship between the drums and the strings adds something very interesting to this piece.

stone-king-ii.title: There is no End
stone-king-ii.description: "There is no End" is the boss music. I like the main groove in this piece. It really keeps everything moving forward and sounds awesome.

stone-king-ii.title: Above
stone-king-ii.description: This piece is the FINAL boss music for "Stone King II!" It has lots of bass that carries the song forward and keeps things interesting. It is a very intense tone that keeps the focus on the fight itself rather than the music. Something I think worked really well with this piece is the phrasing of the melody. It has unique pauses that allow for lots of different sounds to be played instead.

stone-king-ii.title: My King
stone-king-ii.description: I like the orchestral sounds in this piece! It has a very large and wide range of instruments that really keep the groove interesting. Since it's played during the credits of the game, it has a lot of interesting moving parts that are very attention grabbing. I had a lot of fun writing this piece.

poiu.title: A New Sky
poiu.description: A simple and sweet piece that has some cool rhythm challenges. I used a lot of the instrumentation like they were part of the drum set. It was cool to experiment with different accents in the percussion and melodic content.
poiu.albumDescription: Poiu is an album with some very interesting musical ideas. I wrote this album as a way to further understand music theory in greater detail so lots of the pieces are experimental. Due to this, I had a ton of fun trying different, out-of-the-box things musically and just really enjoyed making the different tracks.

poiu.title: asdf
poiu.description: I'm not sure how I wrote this piece, but I think that it's very cool! It has some pretty crazy melodic intricacies that keeps the piece instresting. In addition, the rhythmic complexity is very cool as well. There are a lot of things going on musically with only a few different synths and drums.

poiu.title: Full
poiu.description: This piece slams. I like that it has a overall melody that keeps the piece moving forward while the bass sections just completely slam the rhythmic into the ground! This piece was very fun to write and I like the use of repition as it goes on.

poiu.title: Getting Home
poiu.description: As I was walking home, I was jamming on an idea in my head for the entire journey. I sat down at the music work station and wrote this piece. It came out of no where and I really like that I was able to transition it from how it sounded in my head to the real world. The entire piece is built around that one rhythmic motif.

poiu.title: Just Friends
poiu.description: I love this piece! It is very simple and happy and makes me remember the good and happy days of the past. The piano melody is very neat and it carries the piece very well.

poiu.title: Magic Bean
poiu.description: This piece is huge! Turn up the volume to 11 and really feel each hit of the drums! I love that this piece was a direct result of testing different effects. It is cool how a musician can be sitting, ready to create music and find another idea just by tweaking some settings on the piece they're working on.

poiu.title: Mysterious Seed
poiu.description: This piece is very nice and has lots of relaxing melodies and chords. While writing this piece, I kept to a slower tempo and focused on keeping the melodies focused and unique.
poiu.descriptionShort: Relax and float along in the clouds.

poiu.title: Small Step
poiu.description: This piece was also used in the credits for the ["Stone King"|/games/stone-king] game. I really enjoyed experimenting with the different instruments during their solos.

poiu.title: Structured
poiu.description: This piece is very fun and cute. It has lots of cool melodies that run through the piece and create interesting contrast with the chords. When I listen to this piece I become happier very quickly!

poiu.title: The Interest
poiu.description: "The Interest" is a very cool piece that I like very much! I think that it has extremely interesting melodic conttent and I can listen to it on repeat forever. The piece has a forward-moving drive that is carried by some really cool sounds and keeps me interested at every musical turn.

poiu.title: Epic Smash
poiu.description: This piece is awesome. It holds the intensity all throughout the song and keeps rising and rising until it explodes. My goal with this piece was to hold out the sections and build-ups longer than before. I kept the flow in an upward direction basically throughout the entire piece and focused on keeping the listener amped with some crazy hits.

stone-king.title: In The Red
stone-king.description: This is the great opener for the "Stone King" RPG game. It contains a lot of big and epic sounds. My objective was to introduce the soundtrack of the game with a massive and strong first-impression. I used the 5/4 time signature to keep the listener on his or her toes and really amped up the volume to excite the player and open them up to the world of "Stone King."
stone-king.albumDescription: ["Stone King"|/games/stone-king] is a very epic game that pushes the player to defeat many formidable foes and become victorious! The music reflects that epicness and strives to encapsulate all the greatness of the first Stone King. I use a lot of strings and orchestral instruments to achieve some awesome and bone-chilling melodies.
stone-king.albumDescriptionShort: Dive into the RPG game that started it all!

stone-king.title: Circle of Pain
stone-king.description: This piece provides great atmosphere for learning the backstory of the "Stone King" game. As the player reads the text, this music really captures the super awesome world they are about to experience. I used synths as well as voices with a lot of reverb effects to create some really cool and unique sounds.

stone-king.title: Sunny Day
stone-king.description: This piece is very happy! I used a major key to really convey that home-town feeling. Something I enjoy about this piece is that it uses the left and right panning technique toe create some very interesting tones.

stone-king.title: Like a Plum
stone-king.description: It's time to go on a journey! I like the simplicity of this piece because it does a lot with a little. The percussion is quite limited and that really allows for the melody to stand out. It is so fun!

stone-king.title: True Soldier
stone-king.description: This castle theme really lays on the horns to give off that extreme official-ness of a proper castle. I used a very straight-forward percussion sound to keep the beat and rhythm banging forward. I also had some fun and wrotet a percussion solo in the piece! This is where the player first meets the Stone King so it is crucial that this piece represented how incredible he is.

stone-king.title: Creepin'
stone-king.description: This piece has a strong baseline that really keeps the pace moving forward. I restrict my instrumentation as much as possible witth this piece as to leave a loot of open room in the sound. The melody is very repetitive and quite creepy.

stone-king.title: Safe Quarters
stone-king.description: Dive into the mysterious forest as these strage sounds play some interesting notes into your ears! This piece was used to keep the air with a bit of magical and curiousity to it. I focused on using short notes with a fast melody to upset the sound. All of the different instruments create a magical sound.
stone-king.descriptionShort: I wonder what treasures I'll find here??

stone-king.title: The Summer
stone-king.description: This piece is very light and fluffy. It uses lots of chords from with a major coontext and keeps the mood very nice with simple melodies which utilize excellent chords tones. Since the player is getting closer to some more difficult battles, I really focused on making the music sound more relaxed as if to serve as a rest point before going into soome big battles.
stone-king.descriptionShort: Created for the awesome Isler Village!

stone-king.title: Dead Soldier
stone-king.description: This frightening piece is used to instill fear in the player as they walk through a previously known area that has now become obliterated. To create this unique sound, I combine a few tones that really don't mesh well together with one another and hold various notes that create strong dissonance. I think that something that really works well in this piece is the high-pitched sound that constantly pans from left to right. It really adds to the fear factor!

stone-king.title: Forever Strong
stone-king.description: This piece is truly awesome! It uses a drum set with lots of very interesting rhythmic variations which is quite different from the other songs in "Stone King." As I was writing this piece, I really enjoyed writing the introduction to the A section where it slows down and slams on a myriad of hits on the different drum kit instruments. Since this is basically the opener for the fight, this really gets the player in the right mind set of: "Okay we are about to initiate something really intense!"

stone-king.title: Endless War
stone-king.description: This truly epic piece really brings out the intensity of fighting a boss by utilizing some very interesting chords and rhythmic patterns. I like that it keeps the listener's ear very busy and makes it a bit harder to focus on the gameplay. While fighting a boss it should be intense and difficult! Similar to "Forever Strong," it uses that slowing down effect which I thought turned out pretty awesome!
stone-king.descriptionShort: Time to show this boss what we're made of (steel)!

stone-king.title: Only Hope
stone-king.description: This is the final piece that the player will hear while in a battle. It serves as an epic piece of background music that really tells the player "this is it!" Something I really like about this piece is that it uses some very interesting modulations as the tone seems to rise and rise in intensity. The musical root position of the song changes over and over again which represents the endless height in the difficulty of this battle! Fight with all your might!

stone-king.title: Small Step
stone-king.description: "Small Step" is the song played as the credits. It was written earlier in the year as a fun jam track and I thought it fit nicely in the credits. It's got some pretty wicked solos and I really liked how it fit as the ending of "Stone King!"

writing-clouds.title: Field of Grass
writing-clouds.description: "Field of Grass" is a very fun song that has some nice melodies! Whenever I listen to it I imagine I'm outside on a nice summer day. The piano does a fantastic job of keeping the mood of the song light and happy.
writing-clouds.descriptionShort: Imagine running down a hill during summer with your friends!
writing-clouds.albumDescription: "Writing Clouds" is a fantastic collection of music that I wrote just to write music! It is fun to be creative and not have any sort of goal in mind except to write something on the page. I love how this collection turned out, as it has some very cool tunes in it!
writing-clouds.albumDescriptionShort: Fun, fun, fun music written just to write :D!

writing-clouds.title: The Light Resting within my Arms
writing-clouds.description: This piece is a beautiful collection of synth sounds that keeps me relaxed. I love to listen to this piece and just think about nothing.
writing-clouds.descriptionShort: Float away in the ocean on a boat with some chips and hummus.

writing-clouds.title: Abundant Energy
writing-clouds.description: This piece was also used in the ["Tetris Ages"|/games/tetris-ages] game. It is very nice and has a slow vibration which is quite relaxing. I enjoy this piece because it calms me down and I always think about playing "Tetris Ages."
writing-clouds.descriptionShort: Like a wave in the ocean.

writing-clouds.title: Blue Noise
writing-clouds.description: I like this piece quite a lot! It has a lot of slow moving notes and is primarily in a minor key. It is very meaningful to me and when I hear the opening chords I feel like I'm drifting off into space. It's a pretty cool piece with a nice musical effect.

writing-clouds.title: Philopster
writing-clouds.description: This piece is quite unique. It reminds me of wandering around without any idea where one would be going. All they knew is that the place they were coming from was a place of sadness and sorry. I think the shaker does a fantastic job of keeping the pace of the piece moving forward while the strings hold down the main chords of sadness. The ending of this piece is particularly spectacular because it just drifts off into nothing.
writing-clouds.descriptionShort: Walking down the road without a destination.

writing-clouds.title: Oratosai
writing-clouds.description: This piece is epic! It has some very awesome rises and falls in the music and the tones are great. I like the use of the pentatoic from within this piece. It creates a unique sound environment that really is great.

writing-clouds.title: Flowing River
writing-clouds.description: "Flowing River" has some excellent instrumentation which drives the piece into some awesome sections. I really like the use of the woodwind instruments in this piece, as they bring everything together.
writing-clouds.descriptionShort: This piece flows perfectly through the flowing river.

writing-clouds.title: Hiradoro
writing-clouds.description: I really like the different melodies created by the guitar parts in this piece. These melodies that are interwoven create some very interesting and cool sounds. In addition to that, I like the build up as well as the resolution.

writing-clouds.title: Mega Bomb
writing-clouds.description: This piece has some very cool steel drum sounds that carry the piece forward. I enjoy hearing the how the drums work together to make some sweet tones.

writing-clouds.title: Army March
writing-clouds.description: "Army March" really marches forward with the awesome rhythms and orchestral sounds. It has a massive build up that slowly fades down with strings. This piece definitely served as good writing practice for the castle-based pieces in the "Stone King" games!

writing-clouds.title: Because the Color of my Skin
writing-clouds.description: This piece was excellent practice for staying in the musical groove and then attempting to change the pace near the end. I like the transitions a lot as they make use of some serious dynamics as well as the instrumentation!

writing-clouds.title: Thought
writing-clouds.description: I really enjoy the energy that this piece brings to the table! It has lots of highs and lows which keeps it interesting as the piece goes on. In addition to this, the instrumentation is absolutely fantastic and unique.

writing-clouds.title: Shining Material
writing-clouds.description: Something I enjoy about this piece is that even though it is quite long, it has lots of very interesting mood changes within it. It is happy at some moments then becomes very intense at others. The breakdown section is quite intense and it has lots of cool melodies.

writing-clouds.title: Hardstyle Techon
writing-clouds.description: This piece is very fun and keeps the excitement up as it goes on and on.

writing-clouds.title: What Orange
writing-clouds.description: "What Orange" really pushes the sound through the rhythm. I like the use of piano and saxaphone and their musical relationship.

writing-clouds.title: Hold That Idea
writing-clouds.description: The beat for this piece really holds down the fort. I like the combination of the strings and the drums as it really makes the groove super solid.

writing-clouds.title: Death Break 2
writing-clouds.description: This is the second installment of the "Death Break" series. I really like the sound and melody as the intensity ramps up in the A section. I love to try to write music in different genres and this piece came out in a very interesting way!

writing-clouds.title: Sustain
writing-clouds.description: Awesome!! I wrote this piece to test out some of the awesome guitar sound. It has a really intense volumen and keeps the excitement up the entire time. One of my main goals with this piece was to synchronize the bass drum with the guitar parts as much as possible.

writing-clouds.title: Caged Mine
writing-clouds.description: This epic piece really got into the spirit of syncopation and polyrhythm. This piece definitely important to me as a song writer because it really opened my eyes to the incredible rhythmic variations I can create. Oh yeah, and I wrote this while learning about the five over four poly.

writing-clouds.title: Aim & Fire
writing-clouds.description: This piece really has a lot going on lol. It tests out quite a few different meters running at the same time. It can be a bit confusing because of the massive amount of drum content, but I had tons of fun creating all the different moving parts. Writing music is fun!!

rise.title: Rise
rise.description: Strings, strings, strings! This piece utilizes a lot of capital 'S' Strings to make the piece move forward and ultimately build up to the big ending. There is a lot of awesome crescendo action happening here between the different elements.
rise.albumDescription: Rise is a fun album that really helped me learn and apply a lot of the music theory concepts I was learning. It has some very interesting melodies and chords as well as some extremely dry sections and pieces. I really love this album because as I listen to it, I can really hear the improvement from piece to piece. I think everyone should write/create stuff because it's cool to look back and see all of the awesome development steps that occur!
rise.albumDescriptionShort: Ryan's first few steps as a musician

rise.title: Heart Beat
rise.description: "Heart Beat" is a string-dominant piece that builds up to it's conclusion. I like how this piece is very inspirational in that the tempo really drives the action.
rise.descriptionShort: Sweet chords with the string staccato parts!

rise.title: Calm Aura
rise.description: One of the things I like about song writing is the incredible sounds I can create by changing a few notes of a chord. This piece does a fantastic job of creating a very elegant vibe by just changing some of the notes of the chords.

rise.title: Finding Peace
rise.description: "Finding Peace" is an excellent piece that helps the user find their peace. I think the different sounds come together very well and create an awesome environment. I could listen to this piece on repeat for quite a while because of it's calming sounds. I imagine I will use this piece in the future for a game with a rainy forest area!
rise.descriptionShort: Probably one of the best vibe pieces I've ever written

rise.title: Adventure of Emotions
rise.description: I really like what is going on in this piece. I think this piece has lots of potential and I can definitely hear some major musical development happening. Something I really like about this piece is the movement of the melodies and how they effect each other. Also, the build-up is definitely pretty powerful through repetition!

rise.title: Being Warm
rise.description: This piece has a slower tempo which helps create a more mellow vibe. The melody between the different instruments really brings everything together. While I listen to this piece I actually feel quite a lot warmer.

rise.title: Empty Space
rise.description: I like the different sections in this piece. They all really compliment each other and drive the song. That bell sound is pretty neat as well! Revisiting this piece, I imagine I'm in some kind of magical temple and I can upgrade my items or something.

rise.title: Waltz of Duty
rise.description: This piece is very simple and has some pretty darn neat synth sounds! The 3/4 time signature defines the piece. I like the transitions a lot as well.

rise.title: Feel THE Heat
rise.description: I like the sound of the synth and guitar sound in this piece! It has an awesome attack to it that really turns the heat up!

rise.title: Feel The Groove
rise.description: "Feel The Groove" is a cool piece that uses a constant bass line to carry the beat forward. It is complimented by drums and has some cool changes in the dynamics. Watch out for the drum solo at [01:55]. It has some pretty interesting elements in it and I really feel the improvement as a song writer.

rise.title: Conversation
rise.description: I like the different melodies in this piece. I think having some additional panning between the different parts could make for a really cool effect.

rise.title: Epic Signatures
rise.description: This piece definitely helped me test out writing in different time signatures and tempos. I like the different sounds between each section. They are all different and create high contrast between each of the different parts.

rise.title: Measureless
rise.description: "Measureless" served as an excellent learning opportunity for me as a song writer. I can feel the act of putting down nearly random notes and just thinking how awesome it sounds. The last section definitely has a unique sound to it.

rise.title: Rebellion
rise.description: This cool-guy piece definitely has some awesome elements that make an awesome sound. Each section really has it's own voice and is quite nice to listen to. I definitely like the beat in this piece as it gets into a pretty nasty groove with the other instruments.

rise.title: Come to Life
rise.description: "Come to Life" really woke me up at the beginning of the song when it absolutely initiated the song at maximum power. This is definitely a developmental piece that has some pretty cool rhythms in it. I was absolutely jamming all the way out when I created this piece!

rise.title: Death Break
rise.description: This is the first piece that started the "Death Break" series. This piece slams on the drums loudly and really amps up the excitement with some wicked cool rhythms.

rise.title: Quiet Soul
rise.description: "Quiet Soul" is a piece I like very much because the melody does some absolutely wicked cool stuff. Something I think works very well with this piece is the awesome rhythms that the melodic content uses. I will absolutely circle around back to this piece to grab some ideas for new pieces - there's some really awesome stuff happening in this piece.

rise.title: Dark Walker
rise.description: This piece starts off with some very intense piano hits and keeps that intensity up throughout the piece. This is an example of one of the pieces that shows some great improvement. From a song-writing perspective, I sense a greater knowledge of the inner workings of music creation. This piece was extremely fun to create!

rise.title: Messy Future
rise.description: I love the melodic content in this piece! It is very interesting and has some excellent melodic range. While listening to this piece, I found that an improvement that could be made would be to extend the sections and variate them further. Excellent!

rise.title: Relaxing
rise.description: "Relaxing" is a very nice piece that I could listen to forever. It has an excellent song structure and creates a quite wonderful environment. The different instruments layer well and the vibe it gives off is quite excellent. Very meditative.
